title: Grilled Deviled Chickens Under a Brick
description: Grilling these chickens under a heavy weight will help them cook quickly and evenly, leaving them crisp and juicy.
ingredientLines: 4 baby chickens (poussins) or cornish hens (about 1 1/4 pounds each), or 4 chicken breast halves
1 tablespoon crushed red-pepper flakes, or to taste

title: Stir-Fried Rice with Chinese Sausage
description: While slices of Chinese sausage are good in any stir-fry, my favorite way to use them is in a rice or noodle dish, so the staple soaks ups the fat rendered from the sausage. Used in fried rice, the sausages impart a rich taste to each kernel.
ingredientLines: 2 or 3 links of chineses sausage, cut into 1/4 inch slices
Finely chopped green onion or cilantro

title: Five-Spice Chicken Wings Recipe
description: The sweet heat from the Chinese five-spice powder may not be what you typically think of in terms of incendiary wings, and the crisp skin comes from the blast of a hot oven rather than the splattering of hot oil. Yet we’re quite, quite taken with them all the same. Wingdings for dinner.
ingredientLines: 40 chicken wing pieces, or 20 whole chicken wings
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/3 to 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves
1/4 cup light or regular sour cream
Juice 1/2 lemon (or why not try lime?)

title: Chinese Pork Ribs
description: A superquick family favourite - fab for barbeques.
ingredientLines: 1.0 tbsp vinegar (you can use cider, malt or wine)

title: Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs
description: This rosemary ranch chicken recipe is so delicious, tender, and juicy the chicken will melt in your mouth. Even the most picky eater will be begging for the last piece.
ingredientLines: 5 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes
1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste (optional)

title: Classic lasagne
description: Kids will love to help assemble this easiest-ever pasta bake with streaky bacon, beef mince, a crème fraîche sauce and gooey mozzarella.
